result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leonardo Valadez

records.addlTxt: Defendant Leonardo Valadez not in court - Authorization on file.  Attorney Ashley L Renz in court for Leonardo Valadez.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Samuel Berg. Called - appearances made. Matter before the Court for first status as to both files - 22CM394 & 22CT60. Record by Atty. Renz that she has received global offer. Defendant is trying to get his license back, and is in process of taking classes. Requests status about 90 days out. Court grants request.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

BOND TO COVER 22CM394 & 22CT60

Comply with Any IID Order. Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Leonardo Valadez in court. Attorney Ashley Renz appeared. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
State's Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
